chunk.text: data. In the region of small Ay < 7/2, the fixed-order and the resummed predictions are the same, a result of our matching of the resummed and fixed-order distributions at mid to high values of Qr. Although the cross section is not large in the region Ay < 7/2, there is an indication of a difference between our predictions and data in this region, a topic we address below. It is evident from Fig. 3 that the ∆ϕ < π/2 region is populated mostly by events with QT > Q. New types of radiative ontributions may be present in this region, inluding various fragmentation ontributions desribed in Se. II C and enhanements at large | cosθ∗| in the While experimental isolation generally suppresses long-distance fragmentation, a greater traction of fragmentation photons are expected to survive isolation when Ay < 7/2. Besides single-photon ‘one-fragmentation’ and ‘two-fragmentation’ contributions (with one photon er fragmenting parton), one encounters additional logarithmic singularities of the form og(Q/Qr). We noted in Sec. [1 Clthat these logarithms are associated with the fragmentation of a parton carrying large transverse momentum Q, into a system of small invariant mass Q (27, , alight yy p
